rt.materials

Class Diffuse

  • java.lang.Object
    • rt.materials.Diffuse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Material
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    XYZCheckerboard, XYZGrid

    public class Diffuse
extends java.lang.Object
implements Material
    A basic diffuse material.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface rt.Material

        Material.ShadingSample

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Spectrum kd 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Diffuse()
      Default diffuse material with reflectance (1,1,1).
      Diffuse(Spectrum kd)
      Note that the parameter value is the diffuse reflectance, which should be in the range [0,1], a value of 1 meaning all light is reflected (diffusely), and none is absorbed.

    • Field Detail

      • kd

        Spectrum kd

    • Constructor Detail

      • Diffuse

        public Diffuse(Spectrum kd)
        Note that the parameter value is the diffuse reflectance, which should be in the range [0,1], a value of 1 meaning all light is reflected (diffusely), and none is absorbed. The diffuse BRDF corresponding to is actually /pi.
        Parameters:
        kd - the diffuse reflectance

      • Diffuse

        public Diffuse()
        Default diffuse material with reflectance (1,1,1).

        public Spectrum evaluateBRDF(HitRecord hitRecord,
                             javax.vecmath.Vector3f wOut,
                             javax.vecmath.Vector3f wIn)
        Returns diffuse BRDF value, that is, a constant.
        Specified by:
        evaluateBRDF in interface Material
        Parameters:
        wOut - outgoing direction, by convention towards camera
        wIn - incident direction, by convention towards light
        hitRecord - hit record to be used
        Returns:
        BRDF value

      • getShadingSample

        public Material.ShadingSample getShadingSample(HitRecord hitRecord,
                                               float[] sample)
        Description copied from interface: Material
        Calculate a shading sample, given a uniform random sample as input. This method is typically called in a path tracer to sample and evaluate the next path segment. The methods decides which component of the material to sample (diffuse, specular reflection or refraction, etc.), computes an incident direction, and returns the BRDF value, the direction, and the probability density (stored in a Material.ShadingSample).
        Specified by:
        getShadingSample in interface Material

      • castsShadows

        public boolean castsShadows()
        Description copied from interface: Material
        Indicate whether the material casts shadows or not.
        Specified by:
        castsShadows in interface Material

      • evaluateEmission

        public Spectrum evaluateEmission(HitRecord hitRecord,
                                 javax.vecmath.Vector3f wOut)
        Description copied from interface: Material
        Evaluate emission for outgoing direction. This method is typically called by an integrator when the integrator obtained the outgoing direction of the emission by sampling a point on a light source.
        Specified by:
        evaluateEmission in interface Material
        Parameters:
        hitRecord - Information about hit point on light source
        wOut - Outgoing direction, normalized and pointing away from the surface
        Returns:
        emission value

      • getEmissionSample

        public Material.ShadingSample getEmissionSample(HitRecord hitRecord,
                                                float[] sample)
        Description copied from interface: Material
        Calculate an emission sample, given a hit record and a uniform random sample as input. This method is typically called in a bidirectional path tracer to sample and evaluate the first light path segment. The methods computes an outgoing direction, and returns the emission value, the direction, and the probability density (all stored in a Material.ShadingSample).
        Specified by:
        getEmissionSample in interface Material
